rename.to: Feature: Add support for mixed-types datasets

body:
Can you make sure that boilerplate is at the minimum,
this is quite tricky one.... (code design).

@arita37 We fixed this issue by merging the following PR: 
https://github.com/Neuraxio/Neuraxle/pull/184

Example usage: 
```
        ColumnChooser([
            (range(0, 2), CyclicTimes()),
            (3, CategoricalEnum(categories_count=5, starts_at_zero=True)),
            (4, CategoricalEnum(categories_count=5, starts_at_zero=True)),
            ([10, 13, 15], CategoricalEnum(categories_count=5, starts_at_zero=True)),
        ], n_dimension=3)
```

Note that with `n_dimension=3`, it can process data of shape `[batch_size, ?, n_features_columns]`, where "?" can be replaced by a sequence length for instance.

You could as well use `n_dimension=2` to process regular data of shape like `[batch_size, n_features_columns]`. 

Higher dimension values are possible (e.g.: `n_dimensions=4` to process image features for instance).

Looks like very boilerplate....

Isnt this structure better ?

df_colcat,... = pipeline_split(df,
colnum, 
colcat,
coltext,
coldate,)

Indexing by actual column name is better.

Column name would be interesting, although for now we only support numpy arrays without names so we use integer indices, ranges, or lists of indices. You could use constants to name the integers for now.

1)
Without column  names, you will face tho issues :
   1) check for human is difficult
   2) Cannot be compaible with pyspark
  3) Merge of 2 dataset (column axis) is difficult 
without column names

For many people in ETL area this NG.



> On Feb 18, 2020, at 17:36, Guillaume Chevalier <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> ﻿
> Column name would be interesting, although for now we only support numpy arrays without names so we use integer indices, ranges, or lists of indices.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.

I don't really know PySpark, but for sure it's possible to add columns. Adding columns involves the ability to process Pandas DataFrames, and we didn't explore this avenue yet, despite it'd be quite feasible. Thank you for the suggestions. 

@alexbrillant please note this. We may edit our column transformer later on to add the ability to receive column names and a pandas input, and not just integers of lists indices, which would make the column transformer compatible with both lists, numpy, and/or pandas inputs.
I will rename this issue to address this particular request.

rename.from: Feature: Add support for mixed-types datasets
rename.to: Feature: Add support for string column names in ColumnTransformer for when we use a pandas df as an input

I see what you mean as in this slide at 13:31 in time in the video you've sent: https://youtu.be/XrpSRCwISdk?t=811

So if I understand, you suggest allowing to use column names rather than only integers. And also you suggest to use more NonFittableMixins for pure transformers to use them in PySpark?

This is a very difficult question,
Since it depends on end target users,
Small data or big data.

URIname + column name : universal column_id


2) Problem is :
  Functionnal approach vs OOP for data processing.

  Is Data Processing part of Model training ?
   (Yes, ...)


In the end, you need to find data scientist
or machine learning guys and ask how they write code....
